pages.text:
Skylab is north Florida's largest full service recording studio specializing in audio tracking, mixing, mastering and transfers.
Frequent misunderstandings about making a recording
I don’t have to pay money to record my music, I have a home studio.
You can’t expect to spend $10,000 – $50,000 on a home studio and have it sound as good as a $500,000 – $1,000,000 + dollar studio – even if you’re an electronic artist. Home studios are great for composing and arranging.But, when competing with professional bands, you’ll eventually  need a professional studio to get a great quality recording.
If I have ten songs, I should be able to record them in a few hours.
This doesn’t even happen in the movies. high quality recordings involve a number of processes and setups that require time and precision to properly achieve a high quality sound. Keep in mind that the source of the sound you are making or singing is the most important part of the signal chain. High quality equipment and proper room acoustics cannot make up for bad sound or performances.
As long as we record correctly, we don’t have to spend much time on mixing and / or mastering.
Mixing and mastering is where the magic happens, and makes a HUGE difference in the overall sound and dynamics of the recording. Again, it’s a HUGE difference. It is not uncommonWe recommend a minimum of 1 hour of mixing/mastering for every 2.5 hours of tracking booked.
END .entry-content
END .entry

Skylab is north Florida's largest full service recording studio specializing in audio tracking, mixing, mastering and transfers.
Contact Us
Address:
Skylab Recording Studios
2106 NW 67th Place – Suite 16
Gainesville, FL 32653
Phone:
352.373.7288
E-mail: info@skylabstudios.com
Driving Directions:
From I-75
Take I-75 to exit #390 (NW 39th Ave / Rt 222).
Go east approximatly 4 miles until you reach NW 34th St (also called “cr 121”).
Turn left on 34th Street and go north for approximatly 3 miles.
Go over railroad tracks and make the next right which will put you onto 67th Place.
Turn left into the second driveway which is marked “2106” as you enter it.
Drive all the way to the very back of the parking lot and look for us on the left side (there is a sign that says “Skylab Studios” Suite 16)
From UF Campus
Take 13th Street north
Turn right onto 34th Street (also called cr121)
Take first right at the next light which is 67th Place
Turn left into the second driveway which is marked “2106” as you enter it.
Drive all the way to the very back of the parking lot and look for us on the left side (there is a sign that says “Skylab Studios” Suite 16)
END .entry-content
END .entry

Skylab is north Florida's largest full service recording studio specializing in audio tracking, mixing, mastering and transfers.
Staff
Mark Pinske – Senior Engineer:
Mark Pinske
is the original designer and owner of Pro Media Studios which is now the Skylab Studios facility. Mark has worked with many artists through the years including Frank Zappa, Bobby Brown, Stevie Wonder, Steve Vai, Men At Work and many others. Mark currently resides in California, but can be booked for larger projects if needed.
Thumbnails
Pagination
___________________________________________________________________________
Gerry King – Chief  Engineer:
Founder and owner of Skylab Studios, Gerry began his career years ago under the guidance of Mark Pinske. Through the years, Gerry worked as a tracking engineer, mixing engineer, and studio owner (Skylab Recording Studios) before deciding to dedicate himself to what he enjoyed the most – audio mastering. His client list includes companies as large as Universal Music Group as well as local independent artists with whom he is equally committed to serving. Skylab provides mastering services for all styles of music including country, rock, Jazz, Reggae, EDM, and many others. Give Gerry a call today to discuss your mixing or mastering  project.
___________________________________________________________________________
Kari Bubnow – Operations Manager
When calling our main line, you will probably be greeted by Kari, our operations manager. Bookings, schedules and client accommodations are all handled by her and she is happy to answer any questions or inquiries you may have.
END .entry-content
END .entry
